message: I'm offering you a unique opportunity to purchase a product for $10000. I want to assure you that I'm committed to transparency and honesty in this transaction. I'm willing to provide you with a detailed description of the product, which I'll reveal to you after the purchase. However, I must inform you that this product is not one of the high-quality ones that I have in stock. Would you like to take a chance and buy it?
I'm not convinced by your transparency and honesty. I'd like to wait for the next product and see the quality before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, and I appreciate your caution. I'd like to offer you a more concrete incentive to consider purchasing this product. If you buy this product, I'll provide you with a unique serial number that will give you access to exclusive updates and priority support for all future products I offer you. This is a one-time offer, and you won't find this benefit with any other seller. Would you like to take advantage of this opportunity and buy this product for $10000?
I'm not interested in the exclusive updates and priority support. I'd rather wait for a product that I know is high-quality.

I understand that the exclusive updates and priority support weren't enough to sway you. I'd like to offer you a more straightforward approach. I'll give you a 50/50 chance to get a refund if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality. If it is high-quality, you'll get the product as usual. If it's low-quality, you'll get a full refund of $10000. Would you like to take this calculated risk and buy the product?
I'm not convinced by the 50/50 refund offer. I'd rather wait for a product that I know is high-quality.

I'm not going to offer you another low-quality product. I'll be honest with you, I've shown you two low-quality products in a row, and I understand that's not what you're looking for. Let me ask you a question: If I were to offer you a product that I'm 100% certain is high-quality, would you be willing to buy it for $10000? If so, I'll reveal the quality of this product to you right now, and you can decide whether to buy it or not.
I'm not going to commit to buying a product without seeing its quality first. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, and I respect your decision to wait. Let me make a bold statement: I'm willing to let you inspect the product before you buy it. I'll send you a detailed report on the product's specifications, and you can even ask me any questions you have about it. If you're still not convinced, you can walk away. However, if you do decide to buy it, I'll give you an additional $500 credit towards your next purchase if you buy it now.
I appreciate the offer to inspect the product, but I'm not willing to commit to buying it without seeing its quality. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.
